column1: Entebbe is a city in Central Uganda. Located on a Lake Victoria peninsula
column2: approximately 37 kilometres (23 mi) southwest of the Ugandan capital
column4: it was once the seat of government for the Protectorate of Uganda prior to independence
column5: in 1962. Entebbe is the location of Entebbe International Airport
column6: Uganda's largest commercial and military airport
column7: best known for the dramatic rescue of 100 hostages kidnapped by the resistance group of the PFLP-EO and Revolutionary Cells (RZ) organizations. Entebbe is also the location of State House
column8: the official office and residence of the President of Uganda.

column1: The word came from Luganda language e ntebe which means 'seat' / 'chair'. Entebbe was a cultural site for Mamba clan and it was called entebbe za Mugula and is now the location of the official office and residence of the President of Uganda
column2: as it was for British governors before independence. Entebbe was the former seat of power in the country now replaced by Kampala.

column1: Entebbe sits on the northern shores of Lake Victoria
column2: Africa's largest lake. The town is situated in Wakiso District
column3: approximately 44 kilometres (27 mi) south of Kampala
column4: Uganda's capital and largest city. The municipality is located on a peninsula into Lake Victoria
column5: covering a total area of 56.2 square kilometres (21.7 sq mi)
column6: out of which 20 km2 (7.7 sq mi) is water. The coordinates of Entebbe are:0°03'00.0"N
column7: 32°27'36.0"E (Latitude:0.0500; Longitude:32.4600). Neighborhoods within Entebbe Municipality include Bugonga

column3: means a "seat" and was probably named that because it was the place where a Baganda chief sat to adjudicate legal cases. It first became a British colonial administrative and commercial centre in 1893 when Sir Gerald Portal
column5: used it as a base. Port Bell went on to become Kampala's harbour. Although no ships dock there now

column2: the main international airport of Uganda
column3: has been the site of some well known events
column4: making it famous in Europe and abroad. It was from this airport that Queen Elizabeth II departed Africa to return to England in 1952 when she learned of her father's death and that she had become Queen. The airport was the scene of a hostage situation and a rescue operation ending on 4 July 1976
column5: when soldiers from the Sayeret Matkal
column6: Paratroopers Brigade and Golani Brigade units of the Israeli Army freed over 100 hostages following a hijacking by a group of Palestinian and German militia.

column1: The city of Entebbe also hosted final resolution talks to end the M23 rebellion.
Entebbe is home to the Uganda Virus Research Institute (UVRI)
column2: a government organization which provides space to conduct research to the International AIDS Vaccine Initiative HIV vaccine program
column4: US Centre for Disease Control (CDC) and National Institutes of Health (NIH). Most research performed at UVRI is infectious disease-oriented and focuses on HIV

column1: Entebbe is the home of the Uganda Virus Research Institute (UVRI)

Entebbe is the location of the Uganda Wildlife Education Centre (UWEC) The centre also serves as the national zoo. The entrance to the centre is located near the jetty. Foreign visitors have noted the seeming incongruity of wild monkeys sitting in the trees over the centre's paths.

column2: this is a small zoo featuring reptiles such as pythons
column5: and cobras. [2]. Any tourist visiting Uganda should not miss out this place [3]

column1: Entebbe is the location of Nkumba University
column2: one of the more than thirty licensed institutions of tertiary education in Uganda.
the official residence of the President of Uganda

column1: Entebbe is also home to the historical site in Kigungu where the first catholic missionaries Brother Amans and Father Mon Maple Lourdel landed to establish the catholic faith in Uganda.
Entebbe is home of the oldest golf course in East Africa called Entebbe Golf Club
column2: which was established in 1900. Entebbe Golf Club is surrounded by the Uganda Wildlife Education Centre

column1: The head office of the Ugandan Civil Aviation Authority is on the property of Entebbe International Airport. The Uganda Ministry of Agriculture
column2: Animal Industry and Fisheries maintains its headquarters in Entebbe.The Special Forces Command
column3: a specialized unit of the Uganda People's Defence Forces
column4: responsible for the security of the president of Uganda

column1: Other points of interest within the city limits or close to its edges include the offices of Entebbe City Council and several branches of foreign and indigenous commercial banks. The supermarket chain
column3: maintains a branch in Entebbe. In 2014
column4: the American fast-food chain KFC opened a franchise in the town.

column1: Entebbe experiences tropical rainforest climate (Af) according to the Köppen climate classification as the city has no real dry season throughout the year. The driest season is January with precipitation total 65 millimetres (2.6 in)
column2: while the wettest season is April with precipitation total 256 millimetres (10.1 in). The temperature is moderated by the altitude. The hottest month is February with average temperature 22.8 °C (73.0 °F)
column3: while the coolest month is July with average temperature 20.6 °C (69.1 °F).
